page.title: 16Ecology - Mammals
page.content: There are three mammals which can be seen on the Isle of May. Rabbits are everywhere, and in mediaeval times were farmed, providing a source of income for the monks who owned the island. The black rabbits which are sometimes seen are decendants of pets kept by the lighthouse keepers families. The house mice are not easily observed but are the subject of research by various Universities. There existance has been sustained by the lighthouse keepers although some are now adapted to live outdoor all year round. Finally, grey seals use the North Sea as a hauling-out site and in recent years a breeding colony has established itself there, perhaps an offshoot of the main east coast colony of the Farne Islands.
